Please add DEBUG error message.

Done

Done
Need to mention which operation failed.
Done
Is it possible to have size greater than 1?

There may be a more contained_by associations but there will be only one PCIeSlot.
getAssociatedSubTreePaths fails if there are more than one PCIeSlot.
getAssociatedSubTreePaths fails if there are more than one PCIeSlot.
To understand error log properly we need to mention which operation failed.
Done
same as above.
Done
Redfish.md changes missing.
Done

What if endpoints.size() > 1?
Should we generate an error message in that case?

Ninad also raised the same issue. A PCIe Device is always associated with only one PCIe slot. I have added a check to fail if there are more than one PCIe slots associated with the PCIe Device, but it will never be true.
I've fixed quite a few issues with this patchset.  Please re-review and retest.

Thank you!
I will retest.

This doesn't match phosphor-dbus-interfaces, but also then doesn't appear to be used?

I've removed it.
I thought on https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/61110 we decided that ::invalid would mean an error

Technically it's #2 on this this is where we really documented it.

https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/DBUS_USAGE.md

New commit for function changes
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/64467
I thought on https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/61110 we decided that ::invalid would mean an error

It looks like https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/7a54389415ea264ffdd9605002ee6f61bd6a995f/redfish-core/include/utils/pcie_util.hpp#L130

implements nullopt as "bad interface" and invalid as optional, so as written, this code looks correct.
This is how it is in pcieSlots code. I will fix it in a separate commit and update this.

Fixed. 
New commit for function changes
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/64467

you do ec.value below, ec.value for consistency ?
Also can you add a space after the  getAssociatedSubTreePaths
Done
I've changed this to the prefered coding style.
This capture doesn't look like it's used?
ec.value for consistency
Done

Ed made this change, I don't see anything wrong.
If the "Lanes" property is not present, its default value of 0 will be returned, which is the correct value..
I think a default value of 0 for Lanes is reasonable..

> Should we define these like below?

We shouldn't.  Each of these fields is required on the interface, therefore we need to actually require them in the API.  The way I wrote it is the way I would expect an interface to be read that doesn't have multiple versions required.

0 is just a placeholder to initialize the value to (as is required by the coding standard).  Unless the dbus service publishes zero, it will never be seen by a user.

I'm fine with the this style -- I think probably because those fields are already required and the default values are making sense.
However, in case when some optional fields are used, I think those arguments may need to be defined as pointers (to check whether those fields are present or not).
As explained above, if the xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.PCIeSlot exists, then all properties should have a value. In this case, we return whatever the D-Bus service publishes.
